meanings.definition: To push or thrust with the horns.
meanings.sent1: The bull was tushing the other animals in the field.
meanings.sent2: The rhinoceros was tushing against a tree to scratch its back.
meanings.sent3: The playful goat kept tushing its siblings during their games.
meanings.sent4: The angry ram tushing at the gate made quite a commotion.
meanings.sent5: The buffalo tushing through the bushes created a path for the herd.

meanings.definition: The act of pushing or thrusting with the horns.
meanings.sent1: The forceful tushing of the bull startled the onlookers.
meanings.sent2: The tushing of the bison was a natural behavior during mating season.
meanings.sent3: The playful calf's tushing was more like a gentle nudge than a push.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the tushing echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The tushing of the antelope was a display of dominance in the herd.
